data.enText: the fact that sth must happen or be done; the need for sth

data.chText: 我们认为有必要签订一份书面协议。
data.enText: We recognize the necessity for a written agreement.

data.chText: 我们在讨论是否需要雇用更多员工。
data.enText: We were discussing the necessity of employing more staff.

data.chText: 她从来就没有出去工作的必要。
data.enText: There had never been any necessity for her to go out to work.

data.chText: 这必然是一份简略的、不完全的描述。
data.enText: This is, of necessity , a brief and incomplete account.
a thing that you must have and cannot manage without

data.chText: 许多人甚至买不起食物和衣服之类的基本必需品。
data.enText: Many people cannot even afford basic necessities such as food and clothing.

data.chText: 这样的气候绝对需要有空调。
data.enText: Air-conditioning is an absolute necessity in this climate.

data.chText: 必然性；不可避免的情况
data.enText: a situation that must happen and that cannot be avoided

data.chText: 他觉得在伦敦生活是迫于无奈。
data.enText: Living in London, he felt, was an unfortunate necessity.
necessity is the mother of invention
a difficult new problem forces people to think of a solution to it
to manage to gain an advantage from sth that you have to do and cannot avoid
necessity is the mother of invention
a difficult new problem forces people to think of a solution to it
to manage to gain an advantage from sth that you have to do and cannot avoid

example: food and shelter are necessities of life
the essentials of the good life
allow farmers to buy their requirements under favorable conditions
a place where the requisites of water fuel and fodder can be obtained

tr: the condition of being essential or indispensable

value.def: The necessity of something is the fact that it must happen or exist.

example.ex: There is agreement on the necessity of reforms...
example.tran: 对改革的必要性已经达成了共识。

example.ex: As soon as the necessity for action is over the troops must be withdrawn...
example.tran: 一旦军事行动的必要性不复存在，军队就必须撤出。

example.ex: Most women, like men, work from economic necessity...
example.tran: 与男人一样，大部分女人也是出于经济原因而工作。

example.ex: Some people have to lead stressful lifestyles out of necessity.
example.tran: 一些人迫于生计不得不过着紧张忙碌的生活。

defx.def: If you say that something is of necessity the case, you mean that it is the case because nothing else is possible or practical in the circumstances.

example.ex: The assembly line of necessity kept moving...
example.tran: 生产线势必保持运转下去。

example.ex: Negotiations between the enemies are of necessity indirect.
example.tran: 敌手之间的谈判必定是间接的。

gramarinfo.label: usu PHR before v, PHR n/adj/adv

value.def: A necessity is something that you must have in order to live properly or do something.

example.ex: Water is a basic necessity of life.

example.tran: 食物、燃料和其他日常必需品

value.tran: 必需品;必不可少的事物

value.def: A situation or action that is a necessity is necessary and cannot be avoided.

example.ex: The President pleaded that strong rule from the centre was a regrettable, but temporary necessity.
example.tran: 总统辩解说，实行高度的中央集权虽不尽如人意，但暂时来说却是必要的。

value.tran: 不可避免的情况(或行动)
